008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.color;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012
013import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
014
015/**
016 * This class defines static methods for manipulating and converting RGB colors.
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public abstract class RgbUtils {
021        
022        private RgbUtils() {}
023        
024        /** ITU BR.601 weights for RGB to Y (luma) conversion. */
025        public static final double[] ITU601RgbWeights = {0.299, 0.587, 0.114}; 
026        
027        /** ITU BR.709 weights for RGB to Y (luma) conversion. */
028        public static final double[] ITU709RgbWeights = {0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722}; 
029        
030        public static double[] getDefaultWeights() {
031                return ITU709RgbWeights.clone();
032        }
033
034        /**
035         * Converts the given integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color
036         * to a 3-element {@code int[]} with components red, green and blue.
037         * 
038         * @param argb integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
039         * @return {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
040         */
041        public static int[] intToRgb(int argb) {
042                int[] RGB = new int[3];
043                decodeIntToRgb(argb, RGB);
044                return RGB;
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Converts the given integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color
049         * to a 3-element {@code int[]} with components red, green and blue.
050         * Fills the specified {@code int[]}, nothing is returned.
051         * 
052         * @param argb integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
053         * @param RGB {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
054         */
055        public static void decodeIntToRgb(int argb, int[] RGB) {
056                RGB[0] = ((argb >> 16) & 0xFF);
057                RGB[1] = ((argb >> 8) & 0xFF);
058                RGB[2] = (argb & 0xFF);
059        }
060
061        /**
062         * Encodes the given RGB component values into a single 32-bit
063         * {@code int} value in ARGB format (with transparency A set to zero).
064         * @param RGB {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
065         * @return integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
066         */
067        public static int encodeRgbToInt(int... RGB) {
068                return ((RGB[0] & 0xff)<<16) | ((RGB[1] & 0xff)<<8) | RGB[2] & 0xff;
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Converts the RGB components to Y (luma) using specified component weights.
073         * 
074         * @param RGB color components in RGB (int)
075         * @param weights color component weights (may be {@code null})
076         * @return the resulting luma value
077         */
078        public static float rgbToFloat(int[] RGB, double[] weights) {
079                if (weights == null) {
080                        weights = ITU709RgbWeights;
081                }
082                return (float) (RGB[0] * weights[0] + RGB[1] * weights[1] + RGB[2] * weights[2]);
083        }
084        
085        public static float rgbToFloat(int[] RGB) {
086                return rgbToFloat(RGB, null);
087        }
088        
089        
090        public static int rgbToInt(int[] RGB, double[] weights) {
091//              return Math.round(rgbToFloat(RGB, weights));
092                // this is what TypeConverter.convertRGBToByte() does:
093                return (int) (RGB[0] * weights[0] + RGB[1] * weights[1] + RGB[2] * weights[2] + 0.5); 
094        }
095        
096        public static float rgbToInt(int[] RGB) {
097                return rgbToInt(RGB, null);
098        }
099        // -------------------------------------------------------------
100        
101        /**
102         * Converts integer RGB values (with components assumed to be in [0,255])
103         * to float values in [0,1].
104         * 
105         * @param RGB a sequence of R,G,B values or {@code int[]}
106         * @return the RGB values normalized to [0,1]
107         */
108        public static float[] normalize(int... RGB) {
109                float[] rgb = {RGB[0]/255f, RGB[1]/255f, RGB[2]/255f};
110                return rgb;
111        }
112        
113        /**
114         * Converts float RGB values (with components assumed to be in [0,1]) to integer values
115         * in [0,255].
116         * 
117         * @param rgb RGB float values in [0,1]
118         * @return RGB integer values in [0,255]
119         */
120        public static int[] unnormalize(float[] rgb) {
121                int[] RGB = new int[3];
122                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {                   
123                        RGB[i] = Math.round(rgb[i] * 255f);
124                        if (RGB[i] < 0)
125                                RGB[i] = 0;
126                        else if (RGB[i] > 255)
127                                RGB[i] = 255;
128                }
129                return RGB;
130        }
131                
132        // -------------------------------------------------------------
133
134        /**
135         * Interpolates linearly between two specified colors.
136         * @param ca first color (to be interpolated from)
137         * @param cb second color (to be interpolated to)
138         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
139         * @return the interpolated color
140         */
141        public static Color interpolate(Color ca, Color cb, double t) {
142                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
143                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
144                }
145                float[] a = ca.getRGBColorComponents(null);
146                float[] b = cb.getRGBColorComponents(null);
147                float[] c = Matrix.lerp(a, b, (float) t);
148                return new Color(c[0], c[1], c[2]);
149        }
150
151        /**
152         * Interpolates linearly between the colors in the specified color palette.
153         * The interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1]. If 0, the first palette color
154         * is returned, if 1 the last color.
155         * @param palette an array of colors (at least 2)
156         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
157         * @return the interpolated color
158         */
159        public static Color interpolate(Color[] palette, double t) {
160                if (palette.length < 2) {
161                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("length of color palette must be at least 2 but is " + palette.length);
162                }
163                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
164                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
165                }
166                final int n = palette.length;
167                double x = t * (n - 1);                 // x = 0,...,n-1 (float palette index)
168                int lo = (int) Math.floor(x);   // lower palette color index
169                int hi = (int) Math.ceil(x);    // upper palette color index
170                return interpolate(palette[lo], palette[hi], x - lo);
171        }
172
173}
